item.title: Suppression
item.description: The below heavily draws from @porbotialora’s account. Xianbei campaigns The 1st one was in 446 and was driven by Daoists. Daoism was made into the state religion and Buddhism was outlawed and Buddhist monks and clerics were massacred by the army and Buddhist temples, idols and books were destroyed. This was by a Xianbei emperor who was converted to Daoism by Kou Qianzhi, a Han who was Heavenly master of the northern Heavenly Master sect of Daoism (unlike the southern based one of the Zhang family).
